newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Transavia to take over KLM's Casablanca service.
newsitem.headline: Transavia to take over KLM's Casablanca service.

text.p: Dutch flag carrier KLM Royal Dutch Airlines said on Tuesday its 80 percent owned charter airline Transavia would take over KLM's daily scheduled service between Amsterdam and Casablanca from October 26 of this year.
The flights will be under a code-sharing agreement with KLM.
"This means that the flights that Transavia provides along this route will be listed in the reservations system under a collective flight number," KLM said.
It added that the flights would be run in scheduled slots which are already maintained by KLM, giving travellers better transfer opportunities at Amsterdam's Schiphol Airport.
KLM said it would give Transavia access to the global sales network operated by KLM and its partners.
The capacity freed at KLM by switching the Casablanca service to Transavia will be used in other parts of KLM's European route network.
Transavia is mainly active as a charter airline but is increasing the number of its scheduled services, which will total 15 once it takes over the Casablanca service.
